alert.note: Alert for Adair; Casey; Russell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 12 at 4:35PM EDT until October 12 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT/345 PM CDT/ FOR RUSSELL...SOUTH CENTRAL CASEY AND SOUTHEASTERN ADAIR COUNTIES... At 434 PM EDT/334 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located near Jamestown, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of Russell, south central Casey and southeastern Adair Counties, including the following locations... Eli, Cundiff, Windsor, Teddy, Webbs Cross Roads, Royville, Sano, Karlus, Russell Springs and Russell County Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
